title: Rational Function Graph - Reasoning for Holes

content.description: The function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals x plus 1"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></math>, and the function <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses x plus 1 close parentheses open parentheses 3 x minus 4 close parentheses"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>. Consider the rational function <math alttext="m"><mi>m</mi></math> defined by <math alttext="m open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator f open parentheses x close parentheses over denominator g open parentheses x close parentheses end fraction"> <mi>m</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> </mrow> </mfrac> </math>.
content.question: Which of the following is true about holes in the graph of <math alttext="m"><mi>m</mi></math> in the <math alttext="x y"> <mi>x</mi> <mi>y</mi> </math>-plane?

choices.label: The graph of <math alttext="m"><mi>m</mi></math> has no holes, because all values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> where <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 0"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> determine the location of vertical asymptotes.

The graph of <math alttext="m"><mi>m</mi></math> has holes at <math alttext="x equals negative 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="x equals 4 over 3"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>, because all values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> where <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 0"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> determine the location of holes.

The graph of <math alttext="m"><mi>m</mi></math> has a hole at <math alttext="x equals 4 over 3"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>, because <math alttext="g open parentheses 4 over 3 close parentheses equals 0"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> .

The graph of <math alttext="m"><mi>m</mi></math> has a hole at <math alttext="x equals negative 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math>, because <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> and <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> both have the common factor of <math alttext="open parentheses x plus 1 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> and zero <math alttext="negative 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> with a multiplicity <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math> such that <math alttext="f open parentheses negative 1 close parentheses equals g open parentheses negative 1 close parentheses equals 0"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>.

content.answer: The graph of <math alttext="m"><mi>m</mi></math> has a hole at <math alttext="x equals negative 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math>, because <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> and <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> both have the common factor of <math alttext="open parentheses x plus 1 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> and zero <math alttext="negative 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> with a multiplicity <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math> such that <math alttext="f open parentheses negative 1 close parentheses equals g open parentheses negative 1 close parentheses equals 0"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
